title: How to open a file with a C++ program - Quora

response.answer_text: Hmmm. How to open a file? FILE * fh = fopen(“filename here”, “options here”); Did I miss something? Note that many C++ libraries have a file class (e.g., MFC’s CFile class) but then all you have to do is read the documentation for your particular C++ library to see what is in it.

// basic file operations #include <iostream> #include <fstream> using namespace std;  int main () {   ofstream myfile;   myfile.open ("example.txt");   myfile << "Writing this to a file.\n";   myfile.close();   return 0; } Copied from The C++ Resources Network
